project.name: artwork
project.description: The Gentoo Artwork Project manages Gentoo artwork stuff. This includes wallpapers, logos, themes, icons sets, etc.

longdescription.p: As the community using Gentoo as a desktop operating system continues to grow, one of the main areas which the users tend to concentrate on are the themes and artwork of their desktop. We created this project precisely for these users! The Gentoo Artwork Project (GAP) is a desktop subproject and is responsible for creation and maintenance of all the artwork-related stuff within Gentoo.

body.note: Interested in creating artwork yourself? Check out some of the logos and graphical building blocks you can use.
body.p: The Gentoo Artwork Project welcomes contributions and participation. Areas of involvement could include (but ar not limited to):

ul.li: Create new vector-based artwork that the Gentoo community can relate to
Create close-to-perfect vector-remakes of past work that mattered with no sources available (even after research)

Encourage artwork contributions from the community through
organizing graphics contests (use, target, prices, realization)
coming up with other fresh approaches and their implementation

Communicate with artists of existing artwork:
Encourage variations where it makes sense
Ensure availability of source files (Inkscape, Blender, textures, ..)
Ensure licensing ..
is known and free for all parts
is compatible with the chosen composition
Ensure availability of proper resolutions
big enough, i.e. >1024x768
coverage of aspect ratios, i.e. 4:3, 5:4, 8:5 at least

Maintain and improve artwork related websites in Gentoo, most importantly:
proj/en/desktop/artwork/artwork.xml — Gentoo Artwork
proj/en/desktop/artwork/colors.xml — Gentoo Color Palette
main/en/graphics.xml — Gentoo Branded Artwork
